fact: The Northern Cardinal is known for its bright red color and distinctive crest.
Blue Jays can mimic the calls of hawks, often to scare other birds away.
American Robins are known for their beautiful songs and are a sign of spring in many areas.
The Bald Eagle has a wingspan of up to 7 feet and is the national bird of the United States.
Barn Owls have heart-shaped faces and can hunt in complete darkness.
Common Loons are excellent divers and can stay underwater for several minutes.
Peregrine Falcons are the fastest birds, reaching speeds of over 200 mph during dives.
Scarlet Macaws are known for their bright red, yellow, and blue plumage.
Mute Swans are known for their graceful appearance and are often featured in literature and art.
African Grey Parrots are highly intelligent and can mimic human speech.
Golden Eagles have powerful talons and are known for their hunting prowess.
Great Horned Owls are known for their large size and tufted ears.
Kingfishers have excellent vision and can see into the water to spot prey.
Red-tailed Hawks are commonly seen perched along highways and are known for their distinctive red tail.
European Starlings are known for their impressive murmurations, where thousands of birds fly in coordinated patterns.
Hummingbirds can hover in mid-air by rapidly flapping their wings, up to 80 times per second.
Snowy Owls have excellent camouflage in snowy environments and are known for their white plumage.
Penguins are flightless birds that are excellent swimmers and live primarily in the Southern Hemisphere.
Peacocks are known for their extravagant tail feathers, which they fan out in a display to attract mates.
Flamingos get their pink color from the carotenoid pigments in their diet of algae and crustaceans.
Woodpeckers have specialized skulls and strong neck muscles to withstand the impact of pecking.
Albatrosses have the largest wingspan of any bird, reaching up to 12 feet.
Ostriches are the largest and heaviest birds, and they can run at speeds of up to 45 mph.
Kiwis are flightless birds native to New Zealand, known for their long beaks and nocturnal habits.
Toucans have large, colorful bills that they use to reach fruit on branches.
Cockatoos are known for their expressive crests and their ability to mimic sounds.
Parakeets, also known as budgerigars, are small, colorful parrots that are popular as pets.
Condors are some of the largest flying birds and are known for their impressive soaring abilities.
Puffins are seabirds known for their colorful beaks and their ability to dive for fish.
Ravens are highly intelligent birds known for their problem-solving abilities and complex vocalizations.
Magpies are known for their striking black and white plumage and their tendency to collect shiny objects.
Cranes are known for their elaborate courtship dances and their long migrations.
Swallows are agile fliers and are known for their long-distance migrations.
Swans are known for their grace and beauty, and they form strong pair bonds that often last for life.
Herons are wading birds known for their long legs and necks, which they use to catch fish.
Storks are large wading birds known for their long legs and necks, and they are often associated with delivering babies in folklore.
Pelicans have large bills with a pouch that they use to catch and drain water from their prey.
Seagulls are adaptable birds that can be found in many habitats, including coastal areas and inland.
Pigeons have been used for centuries as messenger birds due to their homing abilities.
Doves are symbols of peace and are known for their gentle cooing calls.
Finches are small, colorful birds known for their beautiful songs.
Sparrows are small, brown birds that are common in urban and rural areas.
Blackbirds are known for their melodic songs and their glossy black plumage.
Robins are known for their red breasts and are a common sight in gardens.
Wrens are small, energetic birds known for their loud and complex songs.
Nightingales are famous for their powerful and beautiful singing, especially at night.
Warblers are small, often brightly colored birds known for their complex songs.
Canaries are known for their beautiful singing and are popular as pet birds.
Hawks are birds of prey known for their sharp talons and keen eyesight.
Eagles are large birds of prey known for their powerful build and impressive hunting skills.
Falcons are fast-flying birds of prey known for their speed and agility in the air.
Owls are nocturnal birds of prey known for their silent flight and excellent night vision.
Vultures are scavengers that play an important role in the ecosystem by cleaning up carrion.
Kites are birds of prey known for their graceful flight and ability to hover in the air.
Harriers are birds of prey that hunt by flying low over fields and marshes.
Buzzards are medium-sized birds of prey known for their soaring flight.
Turkeys are large birds that are native to North America and are known for their distinctive gobble.
Quails are small, ground-dwelling birds known for their distinctive calls.
Pheasants are known for their colorful plumage and are popular game birds.
Grouse are ground-dwelling birds known for their elaborate mating displays.
Partridges are ground-dwelling birds known for their distinctive calls and are often associated with the game bird category.
Cockatiels are small parrots known for their friendly nature and the distinctive crest on their heads
